summary: An email from a law enforcement officer (likely a detective on a joint task force) to colleagues regarding efforts to interview former employees of Jeffrey Epstein who worked at his New York home during the period of alleged abuse. The email includes an attachment with background information on one 80-year-old former employee and mentions a second employee who is harder to locate.

persons.name: Byrne
persons.context: Author of the email, coordinating interviews of Epstein's former employees for the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein, the subject of the investigation. The email references abuse occurring in his New York home and former employees who worked for him during that time.

connections.description: Byrne is a law enforcement officer investigating Epstein and coordinating interviews of his former employees.

events.title: Email coordination for employee interviews
events.description: Law enforcement coordinates via email to interview former employees of Jeffrey Epstein who worked at his New York home during the period of alleged abuse.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively seeking to interview former employees of Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019 as part of the investigation into abuse at his New York home.
One former employee of interest was approximately 80 years old at the time and had worked for Epstein during the period the abuse was occurring.
Investigators referenced a 'massage room' and 'girls coming and going' as topics for the employee interviews.
The email indicates cooperation between the NYPD and FBI on a Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force investigating Epstein.
A second former New York employee was also being sought, but investigators lacked a date of birth or good address for them at the time.
